messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] NEED HELP
messages.msgSnippet: Good afternoon... While I do not know the specifics of your question, I will say that it is my understanding that this type of training would have varied from
messages.messageBody:
Good afternoon...

While I do not know the specifics of your question, I will say that it is my understanding that this type of training would have varied from school to school. Perhaps researching a specific school (Yagyu Shinkage Ryu $BLx@8?71"N.(B, for example) would help?

My area of expertise is philosophy and seppuku, not the sword, but I have two books to suggest:

The Japanese Sword by Gregory Irvine
Kendo by Minoru Kiyota

Kiyota's book has a good portion of information regarding the history of kendo, and the Irvine book deals with the sword and swordsmanship throughout various time periods.

Good luck...

Jonathan Peter Ellgen

Craig <foxes76133@...> wrote: I need some information on how the samurai did the swordmanship
training. I have been looking all over the web, but i can't find what
I'm looking for. Please help~
